sn37:1.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when a female has five factors she is extremely undesirable to a man.
sn37:1.1.3_0: He’s not attractive, wealthy, or ethical; he’s idle, and he doesn’t beget children.
sn37:1.1.4_0: When a female has these five factors she is extremely undesirable to a man.
sn37:1.1.5_0: When a female has five factors she is extremely desirable to a man.
sn37:1.1.7_0: She’s attractive, wealthy, and ethical; she’s skillful and tireless, and she begets children.
sn37:1.1.8_0: When a female has these five factors she is extremely desirable to a man.”

sn37:10.1.1_0: “Anuruddha, when females have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
sn37:10.1.3_0: “... They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, unethical, and witless. ...”
sn37:10.1.4_0: When a female has these five qualities they’re reborn in hell.”

sn37:14.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn37:14.0.2_0: Abbreviated Texts Beginning with the Monastic Code.
sn37:14.1.1_0: “Anuruddha, when females have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
sn37:14.1.3_0: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
sn37:14.1.4_0: When females have these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

sn37:15.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn37:15.1.1_0: Then Venerable Anuruddha went up to the Buddha.
sn37:15.1.1_1: a monk goes and is asking ...
sn37:15.1.2_0: “Sometimes, sir, with my clairvoyance that’s purified and superhuman, I see that a female—when her body breaks up, after death—is reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn37:15.1.3_0: How many qualities do females have so that they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
sn37:15.2.1_0: “Anuruddha, when females have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn37:15.2.3_0: They’re faithful, conscientious, prudent, loving, and wise.
sn37:15.2.4_0: When females have these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
sn37:15.2.5_0: First the first part of the body.

sn37:28.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn37:28.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when a man has one power he has a female under his mastery.
sn37:28.1.3_0: The power of authority. Mastered by this, a female’s powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, children, and ethical behavior do not avail her.”

sn37:31.1.3_0: The powers of form, wealth, relatives, and children.
sn37:31.1.4_0: It is not because of the powers of attractiveness, wealth, relatives, or children that females, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn37:31.1.5_0: It is because of the power of ethical behavior that females, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn37:32.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn37:32.1.11_0: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, and having had children, may I master my husband!’
sn37:32.1.13_0: These are the five things that are hard to get for females who have not made merit.
sn37:32.1.1_0: “Mendicants, there are five things that are hard to get for females who have not made merit.
sn37:32.1.3_0: ‘Having been born into a suitable family!’
sn37:32.1.5_0: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, may I marry into a suitable family!’
sn37:32.1.7_0: ‘Having been born in a suitable family and married into a suitable family, may I live at home without a co-wife!’
sn37:32.1.9_0: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, may I have children!’
sn37:32.2.11_0: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, and having had children, may I master my husband!’
sn37:32.2.13_0: These are the five things that are easy to get for females who have made merit.”
sn37:32.2.1_0: There are five things that are easy to get for females who have made merit.
sn37:32.2.3_0: ‘Having been born into a suitable family!’
sn37:32.2.5_0: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, may I marry into a suitable family!’
sn37:32.2.7_0: ‘Having been born into a suitable family and married into a suitable family, may I live at home without a co-wife!’
sn37:32.2.9_0: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, may I have children!’
sn37:33.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn37:33.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a female living at home with five qualities is self-assured.
sn37:33.1.3_0: She doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
sn37:33.1.4_0: A female living at home with these five qualities is self-assured.”
sn37:34.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn37:34.1.1_0: “Mendicants, a female noble disciple who grows in five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
sn37:34.1.3_0: He grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
sn37:34.1.4_0: A female noble disciple who grows in these five ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
sn37:34.2.1_0: When she grows in faith and ethics,
sn37:34.2.3_0: She is virtuous, ethical, and virtuous,
sn37:34.2.4_0: takes on what is essential for herself in this life.”
sn37:34.2.6_0: The third sub-chapter on strength is finished.
sn37:34.3.4_0: until the end of the ten.
sn37:34.3.5_0: The Linked Discourses on females are complete.
sn37:4.0.1_0: The Linked Discourses on the going forth,
sn37:4.0.2_0: Abbreviated Texts Beginning with the Monastic Code.
sn37:4.1.1_0: “Mendicants, when females have three qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are mostly reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
sn37:4.1.3_0: A female lives at home with a heart full of the stain of stinginess in the morning, jealousy in the afternoon, and sexual desire in the evening.
sn37:4.1.5_0: Their heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, without ill will.
sn37:4.1.6_0: When females have these three qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are mostly reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
sn37:4.1.8_0: Purified by for sure they are,

sn37:5.1.1_0: Then Venerable Anuruddha went up to the Buddha.
sn37:5.1.1_1: he had sat down at a distance.
sn37:5.1.2_0: “Sometimes, sir, with my clairvoyance that’s purified and superhuman, I see that a female—when her body breaks up, after death—is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
sn37:5.1.3_0: How many qualities do females have so that they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell?”
sn37:5.2.1_0: “Anuruddha, when females have five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
sn37:5.2.3_0: They’re faithless, shameless, imprudent, irritable, and witless.
sn37:5.2.4_0: When females have these five qualities, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”
